Summary I continue to be inspired by business owners and love working with community-minded businesses to help them create and implement marketing strategies and content that will create meaningful connections with their target audiences. 
 
Strategies. I’m a bit of a strategist; always watching how businesses market themselves, cheering them on when they make powerful connections, and pondering ways they might do things differently. I’ve always been inspired by business owners and love strategizing with them to identify ways they can Get the Word Out to attract their ideal client. 
 
Content. I’ve always loved to write. When I was in 6th grade, I would help my oldest sister with her writing homework: poems, short stories, and essays. This is when I learned the foundation of great writing: determine your audience and the most important message you want to convey to them. Once in college, I found myself daydreaming about children’s books and scribbling stories in the margins of my notebooks. Writing has always been a fun process for me, and it’s a process that I love sharing with my clients.  
 
Community. Building connections within the Central Coast community and getting to know local business owners is extremely fulfilling to me. I also understand the power of networking, which is why I help my clients build strategic partnerships and create mutually beneficial relationships. 
 
With my passion for strategies, content, and community, it stands to reason that I love identifying the benefits that businesses offer their target audience, then providing suggestions on how they can utilize marketing activities and business processes to build a strong connection with that audience and the broader community. Specialties:Research | Strategize | Communicate Experience Business Manager Hind Inc. March 2012  – Present (3 years 6 months) As Business Manager to the Hind Family, I am able to work on various initiatives to keep multiple businesses in multiple industries moving forward. My current primary focus is within five organizations: Circa Company LLC (www.circacompany.com), GH Sports (www.ghsports.com), Hind Foundation (www.hindfoundation.org), Hind Properties (Commercial Property Management), and Hind Properties Conference Facility (www.hpcfslo.com). For each of these organizations, I conduct different levels of administrative, project management, and marketing tasks. Each day proves to be a new adventure that I continue to learn from and that I am thrilled to take part in. Board Member Spokes - resources for nonprofits October 2011  – Present (3 years 11 months) 997 Monterey Street, 3rd Floor, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401 Spokes opened its headquarter location in San Luis Obispo in October 2011, and I have been fortunate to work alongside a talented and experienced Board of Director, CEO (Lesley Santos Dierks) and staff since then. I currently serve as the Board President and more than enjoy being a part of this meaningful organization that trains and empowers Central Coast nonprofits to fulfill their missions. Board Member Softec September 2010  –  February 2013  (2 years 6 months) I began volunteering and providing marketing services for the Softec Symposium in September of 2010 and becoming a Board Member shortly after. Softec has deep roots in and influence on our Central Coast technology community, and I am proud to have been a part of this organization. Partner Get the Word Out llc January 2011  –  March 2012  (1 year 3 months) Previously FILLERUP marketing communications, we changed the company name to Get the Word Out in January 2011 to better reflect what we did: helped growing businesses get the word out to their target audiences. By writing effective marketing copy and creating efficient marketing strategies, our clients get the word out about their services in a manner that builds brand recognition, client loyalty, and business! Partner FILLERUP marketing communications March 2009  –  December 2010  (1 year 10 months) I began working as a freelance marketing consultant for Beth Fillerup in March of 2009 and became a general partner in the firm in January 2010. In 2011, we formalized our partnership and changed our business name to Get the Word Out llc. During our time as FILLERUP marketing communications, we worked with small- and medium-sized businesses to identify the benefits they offer their target audience, craft messages to clearly communicate those benefits, and create and implement marketing strategies that will create meaningful connections with their existing and potential clientele. We continue to provide strategic marketing services under the business Get the Word Out. Manager of Client Services Grade Potential In-Home Tutoring August 2008  –  February 2009  (7 months) As the Manager of Client Services at Grade Potential, I worked directly with parents and students to identify their tutoring needs and goals, connect them with a tutor who would be the best fit (for both the personality and educational goals of the client), and ensure that they received the service and results they were looking for. I also reached out to local businesses throughout the County to create strategic partnerships. Marketing Coordinator RRM Design Group July 2006  –  July 2008  (2 years 1 month) As a Marketing Coordinator at RRM Design Group, I worked directly with our firm’s technical staff in four different offices to lead, strategize for, and manage proposal submission and interview preparation to acquire public jobs that ranged in value from $100,000 to $10M. I also led the staff to conduct follow-ups on leads, analyze potential projects to pursue, and strategize the implementation of a “win theme” to turn opportunities into projects. In addition, I brainstormed, wrote, and edited creative marketing content for marketing materials, including project case studies, direct mail pieces, the company website, and project proposals and interview materials. FlexForce Sales Representative Intuit September 2005  –  May 2006  (9 months) As a Sales Representative at Intuit, I built relationships with and ensured Intuit’s financial software was optimally placed in retail locations, such as Office Depot, Office Max, Best Buy, Fry’s, and Costco. My personal goal was to transform the customer experience by optimizing product placement, creating marketing displays, and arranging configurations with the consumer’s needs in mind. I was also asked to mentor fellow interns by training them in job processes, product communication, and presentation skills. Online Sales and Operations Specialist Google June 2005  –  September 2005  (4 months) As a summer intern on the Online Sales and Operations Training Team at Google, I tracked employee attendance of trainings, created metrics to assess effectiveness of trainings, and reviewed training surveys to pinpoint areas of improvement. As my final project, I conducted research for, created content for, and presented a training session to support and enhance the job performance of Google Receptionists. In addition, I recorded, digitized, and edited weekly training presentations to enhance final versions of domestic and international sessions. Marketing Associate Second Summer Inc. May 2004  –  September 2004  (5 months) As a summer intern, I worked at this high-end boutique marketing firm to provide research, creative development, and documentation of a new marketing process that incorporated all five senses - sight, taste, touch, sound, and smell - for attracting prospective, affluent financial planners. In addition, I assisted in the development of marketing pieces targeted at elite clientele. Business Manager Hind Inc.
